Award.AwardTitle: Collaborative Research: Development of a Sophomore-Level Course "Introduction of Renewable Energy Manufacturing" and Faculty Expertise

Directorate.LongName: Direct For Education and Human Resources

Award.AbstractNarration:
The project is to develop, assess, revise, and disseminate a sophomore-level course, ?Introduction of Renewable Energy Manufacturing,? and to develop faculty expertise in teaching the course. Project tasks include: (1) draft the textbook for the course and publish it though a self-publishing company; (2) develop lab modules; (3) draft the lab manual and publish it though a self-publishing company; (4) establish a website that contains links to relevant YouTube videos and homework assignments; (5) develop assessment questions for students; (6) visit related manufacturing companies and national renewable energy labs; (7) teach the course at three institutions and conduct both informative and summative assessments; (8) analyze assessment results; (9) revise the draft textbook and lab manual based on assessment results; (10) submit revised textbook and lab manual to a regular publisher; and (11) publish journal and conference papers and make presentations to disseminate findings.

The proposed work will have significant impacts on training the nation?s future workforce in renewable energy manufacturing. Such a workforce is critical for the U.S. to secure its global leadership in the renewable energy industry. This will greatly benefit the U.S. economy, energy security, environment, and society in general. The collaborative work among the three institutions, one of which is a HBCU, will broaden participation and promote diversity in STEM education.

POR.DRECONTENT:
Outcome Report

The Collaborative research project between the HBCU North carolina A&T State University, Kansas State University, and Oregon Institute of technology led to the development and teaching of the course " Renewable Energy Manufacturing" at the three campuses. Components of the courses included develoment of the textbook "Introduction to Renewable Energy Manufacturing" which was published at Lulu.com with chapters encompassing all forms of renewable energy (ISBN:  9781483449982). It also led to the development of the laboratory modules which were used in the practical part of the course. The students in the courses were assessed using faculty prepared tests.  Students' opinions of the course material and the teaching were surveyed through administration of faculty prepared surveys. To prepare the course material, several renewable manufacturing sites were visited that included ocean energy at Oregon State University, and two Companies specializing in Ocean Energy in Oregon. Also, participating faculty visited the solar energy manufacturing company Swinerton Solar near Los Angeles, California. Results of the implementation of the project was partially presented at the 12th Hawaii International Conference on Education in Honolulu, Hawaii. As a result of this project, not only the courses were developed and taught, engineering students from the three campuses, particularly, minority engineering students from North carolina A&T were trained on various aspects of the renewable engy manufacturing. This training will help them in their careers.
